intro: Halimolobos palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's halimolobos, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white to greenish flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. Halimolobos palmeri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
